#summary Building the RDKit code with MinGW.
#labels Development,notes

= Downloads =
  * msys
  * mingw
  * bison: http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/bison.htm
  * flex: http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/flex.htm

= Environment Variables =
  * PATH : must include $RDBASE\bin
  * BISON_SIMPLE : $BISON\share\bison\bison.simple
  * BOOSTHOME, BOOST_BUILD_PATH : pointing to where the boost sources are installed

= Example Environment =
Here's a sample set of environment variables that I have tested. 

=== Code installation details ===
  * Python install : `n:\Python2.5`
  * boost install : `n:\boost_1_37_0`
  * RDKit location : `n:\RDKit_mingw`
  * mingw location : `n:\mingw`
  * msys location : `n:\msys`
  * bison location : `n:\Program Files\GnuWin32`
  * flex location : `n:\Program Files\GnuWin32`

=== Environment variables ===
{{{
export BISON_SIMPLE="n:\\Progra~1\\GnuWin32\\share\\bison\\bison.simple"
export BOOSTHOME="n:\\boost_1_37_0"
export BOOST_BUILD_PATH="n:\\boost_1_37_0"
export RDBASE="n:\\RDKit_mingw"
export PYTHONHOME="n:/Python25"
export PATH=".:/usr/local/bin:/mingw/bin:/bin:/n/Progra~1/GnuWin32/bin:/n/python25:/n/RDKit_mingw/bin"
}}}
(Note, that's only part of my PATH, but it's the relevant bit.)

=== Process ===

This may not be optimal, but it works.

From inside the msys shell:
  # `cd $BOOSTHOME/tools/jam/src`
  # `./build.sh`
  # `cp bin.ntx86/bjam.exe /usr/local/bin`
  # `cp bin.ntx86/bjam.exe $BOOSTHOME`
  # `cd $BOOSTHOME`
  # `./configure --with-bjam=./bjam.exe --with-libraries=python,thread --prefix=n:/boost'
  # `bjam --toolset=gcc --with-python --with-thread`
  # `cd $RDBASE/Code`
  # `bjam --toolset=gcc`
